title: Quiz 8: Climacteric Crisis & Menopause
description: Evaluate knowledge on menopause symptoms, physiological changes, and management strategies.

questions.question: Menopause is officially declared after ___BLANK___ year(s) of complete absence of menstruation.
questions.explanation: Clinical definition requires 1 full year of amenorrhoea.

questions.question: Which of the following are common symptoms of the Climacteric Crisis? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Weight gain (not loss) is common. Hot flushes, osteoporosis, and atrophy are classic signs.

questions.question: What is the most common symptom of menopause, experienced by 80-85% of women?
questions.explanation: Hot flushes are the hallmark vasomotor symptom of menopause.

questions.question: Why does Osteoporosis occur during menopause?

options.text: Oestrogen deficiency leads to calcium excretion

questions.explanation: Estrogen protects bone density. Its decline causes increased calcium excretion and bone loss.
questions.hint: It relates to the primary female hormone.

questions.question: Match the management strategy with the symptom it treats:

pairs.right: Suppresses hot flushes and prevents osteoporosis

questions.explanation: Specific treatments target specific physiological deficits.

questions.question: Sexual desire usually disappears completely once menstruation ceases.
questions.explanation: Sexual desire is present in most women for many years after menstruation ceases.

questions.question: What is a potential risk of long-term unopposed oestrogen therapy?
questions.explanation: Unopposed estrogen increases the risk of endometrial cancer. Progesterone is added to prevent this.
questions.hint: It causes proliferation of the lining.

questions.question: In Kenya, hot flushes are often mistaken for which conditions?
questions.explanation: The feeling of heat and sweating mimics febrile illnesses like Malaria.

questions.question: Dietary advice for menopausal women should include: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Calcium for bones, Soya/Plants for phytoestrogens. High fat is bad due to slowed metabolism.

questions.question: Post-menopausal bleeding should never be accepted as normal and must be investigated to rule out ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: PMB is a cardinal sign of gynaecological cancer (cervical or endometrial).
